author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: This figure will be timeless
review:
Opening;

Clock king is one of the most goofy and ridiculous Batman villains and his minifigure rendition is of the best from the Batman movie series two .

The Minifigure-

The figure reuses the gingerbread man head just with a new print flipped around and in blue there is a very nice green cape , his torso features the alarm clock pattern and this continues on to the legs , arms and side legs .

The Accessories-

are fairly bland but get the intention of the hands of a clock across the stand is the regular Batman movie series two printed Batman emblem .

In conclusion-

this is a great figure with very detailed prints the only downside is the bland Accessorys however I still recommend picking it up .

author: Odeinoichus
title: Villainous Terror of Clocking Out!
review:
Set #71020 Clock King: My exposure to the character of the Clock King is strictly from the 1990s animated series where he played a pivotal role in a few key episodes. For The LEGO Batman Movie, the character's outlandish costume choice was decided upon for the fun humour typical of LEGO.

Clock King from that series is not Clock King here, this represents the original Comic version of Clock King. He dresses in a ridiculous looking blue suit with images of time pieces printed all over it, he includes a green cloth cape and his head is re-using the Gingerbread Man head, the reverse side has been printed with a clock face, while the sculpted portion with eyes has rivets and visible gears seen inside the sculpted area for the eyes on the Gingerbread Man. A very clever re-use of parts.

Carrying two spears meant to represent Minute Hands (The Second Hand is smaller and therefore he isn't using any, ) our friend Clock King is a highly impressive looking representation of a very E-List Rogues Gallery Villain. Overall I feel this character looks great, is very fitting for The LEGO Batman Movie and works very well with the part choices. He comes Highly Recommended.
